Problem:
class WeatherSimulator { void simulate(int days, boolean rainySeason) { for(int i = 0; i < days; i++) { if(rainySeason) { System.out.println('Rain'); } else { if(Math.random() > 0.5) { System.out.println('Sun'); } else { System.out.println('Cloudy'); } } } } }",

If the simulator is run during the rainySeason, will it always print 'Rain'?
Explanation: The code explicitly checks if it is the rainySeason and prints 'Rain' every day of the simulation if that condition is true, without considering any other factors.

causal_map_integration: If rainySeason is true, then Rain will be printed.
